The holy Gospels / narrated the mystery / of the Birth of our Savior / from the Virgin Mary.

A luxurious praise and rich veneration is this honorable commemoration of the holy Annunciation, the glorious pure Nativity, and the honorable magnificent Resurrection of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. To Him who is coessential with His good Father, and the Holy Spirit, the Life-Giver, be glory forever. Amen.

Come today, O you believers and lovers of Christ, let us rejoice and be glad by singing spiritual and heavenly hymns on this great day, the twenty-ninth of this month. On this day, the Lord sent the Archangel Gabriel to our Lady to announce the Incarnation of the eternal Word of God, our Savior Christ, the Son of God, who is begotten before all ages and one with the Father in eternity and divinity.

On this day also was the miraculous Nativity of our Lord Jesus Christ from the pure Virgin; that is the Nativity of the King of Kings and Lord of Lords, our Lord Jesus Christ

On this day also was the honorable Resurrection of our Savior from among the dead, which He completed by His good Economy, that what the prophets had prophesied may be fulfilled. The pure evangelists witnessed to this and preached to all the regions of the earth.

Bethlehem was thus glorified from among the towns and cities, for in it was born our Savior, wrapped and placed in a manger. All the luminous hosts worshipped His divinity and praised His glorious lordship.
هوذا بيت لحم قد ا?تخرت على المدن والقرى. لأنه قد ظهر منها مخلصنا مولوداً مل?و?اً موضوعاً ?ي مذود. سائر المراتب النورانية تسجد لعظمة لاهوته مسبحين لمجد ربوبيته.

We ought, our spiritual fathers and our elect brothers, to spiritually celebrate this feast of the twenty-ninth day of the month, chanting and praising heavenly hymns. For on this day was salvation and joy for the human race on account of the life-giving Annunciation, the virginal Nativity, and glorious Resurrection which saved us from the hand of the enemy. The glory of the divine Christ and the light of His Resurrection shone upon those who were in exile in Hades, and they were returned to Paradise once more.

Blessed are those who commemorate this glorious feast and may their offerings be elevated upon the holy altars. Blessed is the one who visits the [poor] brethren of Christ on this day. Blessed is the one who labors in freeing those in captivity on this day. Blessed is the one who visits those in prison, as the Lord enables him. Blessed is the one who consoles those who mourn: those in poverty. Truly the Lord will save him from all the worldly troubles and he shall not lack anything from the Lord. May the Lord multiply His grace and blessings upon him, that he may overflow unto others, and receive eternal blessings of non-perishable joy.

Let us sing with a joyful voice saying, “Hail to Bethlehem, the city of the prophets, whence Christ our Savior was born of the Virgin Mary, the pride of all virgins, without seed of man! Hail to Bethlehem, whence shone the light of Christ, before whose divine glory the luminous hosts tremble! Hail to Bethlehem, whence was born He who sits upon the cherubic throne! Hail to Bethlehem, which became like heaven, for He whose greatness is praised by the heavenly, is now also praised by the earthly in Bethlehem!

“Hail to the city of God, Jerusalem, upon which the great throne was erected where Salvation came to our father Adam and his offspring through the Cross! Hail to the Mount of Cranium, where our Savior was lifted up on the Cross and His holy hands were nailed to it!? These revelations were revealed to the early fathers before the divine Incarnation. Hail to the life-giving sepulcher where the pure Body of our Lord was laid, and to the holy cave where the wood of the Cross was hidden!

Hail to the holy Resurrection, when our Savior appeared to His own disciples after He rose from the dead on the third day after His crucifixion! Hail to the city of God, Zion, where upon the Holy Spirit descended! Hail to the holy wilderness of the Jordan upon which the pure feet of our Lord walked, and He was baptized by John the Baptist, the son of Zacharias.

Rejoice, O Virgin Mary, for you were worthy to receive that great Annunciation, of the Incarnation of the Word of God the Father, who was incarnated from you, and was born as a human. You fed from your breast the One who sustains the whole creation. Therefore, we magnify you with the Archangel Gabriel saying, “Hail to you O full of grace, the Lord is with you!? Intercede on our behalf before your beloved Son so that He may strengthen us in the true faith, have mercy on us according to His great mercy, save us from the troubles of this world and from our adversaries, soften the hearts of those having authority over us, and grant us the forgiveness of our sins. Praise be to God forever. Amen.
